results.title: The Enforcer
results.creator_credit: Milton Sperling, Warner Bros Pictures and Brent Productions
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart portrays District Attorney Martin Ferguson whose efforts to crack an organised crime syndicate are jeopardised by the suicide of his sole eyewitness on the eve of the trial. Ferguson has only 12 hours to prepare a new case in order to bring crime boss Albert Mendoza (Everett Sloane) to justice. A suspenseful thriller written by Martin Rackin and based on the ‘Murder Inc.’ case. Cast also includes Zero Mostel, Ted De Corsia, Roy Roberts and Lawrence Tolan. Music by David Buttolph, cinematography by Robert Burks and editing by Fred Allen.

results.title: The Energy picture
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, Gerald Potterton and John Halas
results.brief_description: The story of man’s use of energy from the days of primitive sun worship to the present time. It took man a long time to find sources of energy - apart from man power - which he could harness to his own ends. For centuries he knew only of the horse, water, wind and fire. Then came coal, the steam engine, the Industrial Revolution, and the internal combustion engine using petrol. Today oil is the greatest source of energy. Commentary by Maurice Denham

results.title: The Energy management program
results.creator_credit: John Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
This video is part of “The Energy management program” commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria. In this episode interviews are conducted with energy managers who have proven they can reduce costs while at the same time improving building comfort and helping the environment.

results.title: The Energy crunch: the nuclear dilemma
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Wade, British Broadcasting Corporation and Patrick Uden
results.brief_description: Explores the possibility of using nuclear energy for the safe production of electricity. Shows the increasing demand for power that cannot be met by the current available resources. States the potential dangers involved in switching to nuclear power

results.title: The Energy crisis
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Review: 26th year”.
An examination of how Britain’s way of life was affected by the patterns of energy supply. The film makes a forecast for the future.

results.title: The Energy carol
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Conservation and Renewable Energy Branch, Energy, Mines and Resources Canada, Wolf Koenig, Sidney Goldsmith and Les Drew
results.brief_description: An animated film dealing with conservation of energy resources. Ebenezer Scrooge has a motto: to waste is to grow. His motto becomes: back to basics. “The Energy carol” traces this momentous transformation, and introduces us to the spirits of energy past, present and future (Award: New York)

results.title: The Energy audit
results.creator_credit: John Hipwell, Mark Poole, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as part of a series of videos outlining practical ways to measure energy use in commercial buildings, this video concentrates on conducting an energy audit. In turn, this will help the building manager in completing an energy management program with the aim of identifying opportunities for energy cost saving.

results.title: The Enemy within (2003) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bonnie Thompson, Jerry Krepakevich and Eva Colmers
results.brief_description: In World War II thousands of German prisoners-of-war were sent to camps in Canada where they saw out the war, many for several years. This documentary examines the experiences of a few of those men, as well as presenting the perspectives of the Canadian guards. Filmmaker Eva Colmers (a German-born resident of Canada) focuses on the story of her father - a POW who has fond memories of his time in captivity. If this seems disingenuous, it is through a series of interviews that he reveals that he was well fed, well treated and educated during his confinement. Of interest here is also the workings of a POW camp — how the men strictly adhered to their rank and values as soldiers, even remaining loyal to Hitler. What is clear is that they were treated with respect that fostered loyalty, to the point where the prisoners were released to work on farms, and as lumberjacks, and were even allowed at times, to wander beyond the barbwire. Overall this is a fascinating tale that mixes interviews with archival footage, thus presenting a very humanistic slant on what was a cruel and murderous time in history.

results.title: The Enemy within
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
Snowy Baker, is a secret service agent called in to crack a ring of foreign agents involved in treason and civil violence in Australia. Jack’s sweetheart, Myee, is kidnapped by the villains, but after a long chase Jack is able to trap the enemy and rescue Myee.
